definition: to be dispersed/to break down/to fester/to ulcerate
"water" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 85), occurring in 没, 法, 流 etc/see also 三點水|三点水[san1 dian3 shui3]
to flee in disorder/defeated and in rout
to collapse on the first encounter/to give way at once
an ant hole may cause the collapse of a great dike (idiom)/huge damage may result from a moment's negligence
pinyin: qian1 li3 zhi1 di1 , kui4 yu2 yi3 xue2

sentences.english: I need some paper to dry the coffee spill.
sentences.chinese: 我需要一些紙把濺灑出來的咖啡潰擦乾。

sentences.english: The systemic studies of Kuijieping Granule, a new drug for the treatment of colonitis, were made in this paper.
sentences.chinese: 本文對治療結腸炎的潰結平顆粒作了較爲系統的研究。

sentences.english: Aspirin can ulcer the stomach lining .
sentences.chinese: 阿司匹林能造成胃壁潰。

sentences.english: Aspirin can ulcerate the stomach lining.
sentences.chinese: 阿司匹林能造成胃壁潰。

sentences.english: CONCLUSION The study suggested the Kuijiekang tablets had good microbially triggered colonic delivery property.
sentences.chinese: 結論研製的潰結康片具有結腸酶解釋藥特點。

definition: chain/cable (unit of length: 100 fathoms, about 185 m)/chain (unit of length: 66 feet, about 20 m)/to chain/to enchain
to extinguish or put out/to go out (of a fire etc)/to exterminate or wipe out/to drown
simple/uncomplicated/letter/to choose/to select/bamboo strips used for writing (old)
to hold back/to restrain/to control (oneself)/to collect/Taiwan pr. [lian4]
to draw tight/to stretch taut/to tack (with thread or pin)/embroidery hoop/woven bed mat
surname Lou/one of the 28 lunar mansions in Chinese astronomy
door to women's room/gate to palace
